Class AnimationRenderable

java.lang.Object
danogl.gui.rendering.AnimationRenderable
All Implemented Interfaces:

public class AnimationRenderable extends Object implements Renderable
A dynamic, repeating animation.
Author:
Dan Nirel

  • Constructor Details

    • AnimationRenderable

      public AnimationRenderable(String spritesheetPath, int rowCount, int colCount, int rowIndex, ImageReader imageReader, boolean useTransparency, double timeBetweenClips)
      Creates an animation from a spritesheet - a single image file that contains multiple images successively. The order is assumed to be left to right. This method does not support reading only part of the row, for that you'd need to crop it first (either externally or with RenderableImage.crop). Also supports reading a single row from a spritesheet with multiple animations.
      Parameters:
      spritesheetPath - Absolute or relative path to the spritesheet image file.
      rowCount - If the spritesheet contains only one animation, this would be 1. Otherwise, specify how many animations are contained in the spritesheet.
      colCount - How many sprites in the animation (number of columns). This should be at least 1.
      rowIndex - If the spritesheet contains only one row of animation, this would be 0. If multiple rows exist, a non-negative value means using the row with this index. A negative value means using all rows as a single animation (left to right, top to bottom)
      imageReader - To read the images with.
      useTransparency - Should the top-left pixel of the spritesheet be considered a transparent color for all images.
      timeBetweenClips - The time to wait before moving to the next clip.

    • AnimationRenderable

      public AnimationRenderable(Renderable[] clips, double timeBetweenClips)
      Initialize the animation using Renderables
      Parameters:
      clips - The animation's clips.
      timeBetweenClips - The time to wait before moving to the next clip.

    • AnimationRenderable

      public AnimationRenderable(String[] imagePaths, ImageReader imageReader, boolean useTransparency, double timeBetweenClips)
      Initialize the animation using file-paths of images on disk
      Parameters:
      imagePaths - Paths of images on disk.
      imageReader - To read the images with.
      useTransparency - Should the top-left pixel of every image be considered a transparent color for that image.
      timeBetweenClips - The time to wait before moving to the next clip.

    • AnimationRenderable

      public AnimationRenderable(String directoryOfImages, ImageReader imageReader, boolean useTransparency, double timeBetweenClips)
      Initialize the animation using a directory containing images only. The images are sorted by name to determing the animation's order.
      Parameters:
      directoryOfImages - A directory path; the directory should contain image files only.
      imageReader - To read the images with.
      useTransparency - Should the top-left pixel of every image be considered a transparent color for that image.
      timeBetweenClips - The time to wait before moving to the next clip.

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update(double deltaTime)
      Description copied from interface: Renderable
      This should be called every frame if the Renderable is dynamic. Implementing this method is optional.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Renderable
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - Time since last frame

    • render

      public void render(Graphics2D g, Vector2 topLeftCorner, Vector2 dimensions, double degreesCounterClockwise, boolean isFlippedHorizontally, boolean isFlippedVertically, double opaqueness)
      Description copied from interface: Renderable
      Renders the object. Should be called at the render phase.
      Specified by:
      render in interface Renderable
      Parameters:
      g - The graphics object.
      topLeftCorner - Top-left corner of where to render the renderable.
      dimensions - Dimensions of the renderable (in pixels).
      degreesCounterClockwise - Angle of the image. The image is rotated around its center.
      isFlippedHorizontally - True to mirror the renderable (left-right).
      isFlippedVertically - True to mirror the renderable (up-down).
      opaqueness - 1 for opaque, 0 for invisible, values in between for degrees of transparency.

    • resetAnimation

      public void resetAnimation()
      Reset the animation (go back to the first frame).
